content: Sembra un problema analogo a quello discusso qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1445562 vedi se le soluzioni proposte ti sono di aiuto
creator: @next

content: If it was a POP account, and if the old computer will boot, you could copy the profile folder to external medium and then copy to new computer to retrieve. If computer won't boot, a tech support person could remove hard drive and extract data for you. The profile on old computer would have been at the c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder. Retrieving that thunderbird folder is key. If you can do that, we'll proceed to next step.
creator: davidsk

content: Ah, dimenticavo di dire che stiamo parlando della versione per Windows (11, 64 bit).
creator: nemulisse1

content: Ho risolto il problema. Ho salvato le cartelle del mio profilo, dopodiché ho disinstallato Thunderbird con Revo-uninstall e reinstallato il programma. A questo punto è andato tutto a posto.
creator: nemulisse1

content: Thank you for your desire to donate. We all appreciate it. Sometimes there are glitches in online transactions, and I hope you try again. We rely on the generosity of donors such as you for ongoing development and support. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: I may not be fully grasping your issue. For me, all it took was going to settings>general and clicking the 'color's button and changing background color. I Untick 'use systems colors' - In settings>composition, I DO tick 'use reader's default colors' - I am using the light theme.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David,

Thanks for replying. I should clarify a few things. First, I am using Thunderbird 115, on OSX. From what I can tell, the default theme is dark, and there is no obvious, available way to change to a light theme.

Next, I have done just as you advise, unticking 'Use system colors,' and setting text to black and background to white. It simply does not affect anything, even after relaunching the app. Screenshot is attached, just so you know I am not making this up.

Any advise from here? Thanks!
creator: stevenstromer

content:
Oh. My. God.

The setting is in 'Composition,' not in 'General.' I could have just saved myself a few hours of research. Evidence that it sometimes it is better to not know how to look under the hood. I'll mark it up to learning about the underlying workings of a great app. Thanks so much for this!
creator: stevenstromer

content: I have usually found that exiting and restarting thunderbird gets by the issue.
